moves.1... e5: The most common response at this level
moves.2. Nf3 Qf6: Hmm, I'm not sure I like this. It develops the queen too early and takes away the knights best square.
moves.4. d3 d6 5. Bg5: Okay, I don't like this move. It forces the queen to move and vacate the knight's favorite square.
moves.5... Qg6 6. Nc3 c6: It takes away the knights best square, but it prepares d5 so maybe it's okay
moves.7. O-O Bg4: Pins my knight. Looks serious at first sight because it removes defense of my DSB, but if he takes it and I take it back, and he takes my queen we are equal after I take his bishop with a rook.
moves.8. Bh4: ? I don't see why I moved it. Maybe I was worried about the pin.
moves.9. Bg3 Bg4 10. b3 h5: The start of a pawn storm maybe?
moves.11. h3: I don't really like the bishop there.
moves.11... Bd7 12. Qe2: probably should have moved it to c1 maybe.
moves.15... Nxe5 16. Qxe5+ Be6: Ouch, this move allows a discovered attack that will win black's DSB
moves.18... h4: Makes me move my bishop but doesn't seem to do much
moves.20. Nb5 b6 21. Qd6 a6: Doesn't seem to accomplish much, my knight wasn't really doing anything there.
moves.22... Ra8 23. Bxb6: Takes a pawn and defends the knight at the same time.
moves.24... Ng4: Even if it weren't for the mate threat this isn't really a good move.
